item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 15, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Deepseek R1 Distill 8B Q40 on 4 x Raspberry Pi 5, 6.43 tok/s (eval 11.68 tok/s) (228 points | 105 comments)
2. Schemesh: Fusion between Unix shell and Lisp REPL (24 points | 1 comment)

6. Jane Street's Figgie card game (303 points | 51 comments)
7. New SF public health chief was part of McKinsey opioid-marketing operation (19 points | 1 comment)

9. Darcs, Friendly Version Control (47 points | 35 comments)
10. The 20 year old PSP can now connect to WPA2 WiFi Networks (361 points | 110 comments)
11. We were wrong about GPUs (740 points | 476 comments)
12. Show HN: Kreuzberg – Modern async Python library for document text extraction (121 points | 53 comments)
13. More Solar and Battery Storage Added to TX Grid Than Other Power Src Last Year (63 points | 36 comments)
14. The hardest working font in Manhattan (642 points | 96 comments)
15. Alzheimer's biomarkers now visible up to a decade ahead of symptoms (46 points | 10 comments)

19. It's a knowledge problem Or is it? (21 points | 4 comments)
20. Surprise Magma Chamber Growing Under Mediterranean Volcano (22 points | 3 comments)
21. Show HN: Letting LLMs Run a Debugger (97 points | 21 comments)

23. Did Semgrep Just Get a Lot More Interesting? (156 points | 65 comments)
24. TL;DW: Too Long; Didn't Watch Distill YouTube Videos to the Relevant Information (212 points | 149 comments)
25. Recurring checklists using Org Mode in Emacs (78 points | 4 comments)
26. Why I'd never apply for a job online again (24 points | 1 comment)
27. If you ever stacked cups in gym class, blame my dad (285 points | 42 comments)
28. Complex dynamics require complex solutions (200 points | 124 comments)
29. Show HN: I Built a Reddit-style Bluesky client – still rough, but open to ideas (85 points | 21 comments)
